In Paris, tour buses spark growing debate over the impact of tourism
subhead: As coach operators complain about increasing difficulties navigating and parking in the French capital, City Hall says it wants fewer tour buses in the city. But so far, there are no real alternatives.

title: US seizes second oil tanker off coast of Venezuela

'Ocean Viking migrant rescue ship stands as the last guardian of the law in international waters'
subhead: Maritime law requires every captain to assist anyone in distress at sea. By delegating the coordination of rescue operations to actors who flout this law, European states have abandoned the enforcement of international law on the high seas, warns a group of maritime sector professionals in an opinion piece for Le Monde.

title: Hosts Morocco open Africa Cup of Nations under heavy expectations
subhead: Fresh off their Arab Cup triumph in Qatar on Thursday, Morocco begins the Africa Cup of Nations on home soil on Sunday hoping to thrill its fans and finally end a 49-year wait for continental glory.

title: Da Vinci's secret tunnels at Milan's Sforza Castle appear to be nothing more than sewers
subhead: Researchers from the Politecnico di Milano claim to have discovered mysterious underground passages beneath the medieval fortress that match sketches by the Italian master. But historians specializing in the period sharply dispute this theory.

title: Santa Claus in France is a temp worker: 'It helps make ends meet'
subhead: Retirees, actors, entrepreneurs: They don the role of Santa Claus in shopping malls, at Christmas markets or via video calls for private customers. Few people rush to apply for this job, which sometimes involves difficult working conditions, although the most experienced among them still appreciate it.

A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhead: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.

title: Perrier: Nestlé allowed to continue natural mineral water production despite recent contamination incidents
subhead: French authorities issued on Friday a decree authorizing the Swiss multinational to operate the Perrier springs in Vergèze, southern France.

title: Trump dogged by cost of living crisis and Republican revolt
subhead: The US president tried to defuse Americans' dissatisfaction with the economy in a televised address on Wednesday. He continued to blame Joe Biden, but struggled to grasp the extent of the issue – provoking tensions within his own party.
